subject: Re: problem with Junit.
msgSnippet: I have no idea if this is the problem or not, but nobody else has replied yet, so I ll give it a shot. It looks like junitreport can t find the XML file it is

I have no idea if this is the problem or not, but nobody else has 
replied yet, so I'll give it a shot.

It looks like junitreport can't find the XML file it is trying to render 
into a report.  Make sure that PDFRenderingServiceTest.xml is available 
and in the expected location when junitreport is run.

Good Luck,
Chad

shkundur wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I am a new member of this group.
> 
> I was searching on web for the solution of my problem in case anybody 
> else had already faced the same problem which I have now.
> 
> I saw Mr. Steve Kelem had the problem  a long time ago.
> 
> The error I was getting when running ant on my system is as follows.
> 
>     [junit] Running 
> com.slma.eagle.letter.aia.test.PDFRenderingServiceTest
> [junitreport] [Fatal Error] :-1:-1: Premature end of file.
> [junitreport] The file C:\build\aiaService\testresults\TEST-
> com.slma.eagle.lette
> r.aia.test.PDFRenderingServiceTest.xml is not a valid XML document. 
> It is possib
> ly corrupted.
> [junitreport] Using Xalan version: Xalan Java 2.4.1
> [junitreport] Transform time: 1532ms
>      [echo] See results in: testresults/index.html
> 
> I am using jdk1.3.1_09 , ant 1.5.1 and JUnit 3.8.1.
> 
> could anybody please let me know if you had solved the problem 
> earlier.
> 
> Thank you.
> Shailaja.
